Description: Green basalt block-statue; eleven rows of incised hieroglyphic text round the body identifying the owner as Harwa, high steward to the divine adoratrice Amenirdis I; damage to the back of the head and front left corner of the plinth.
Curator's comments: See PM viii, p. 848. Published: B V Bothmer in Fs. Leclant, 1993, Vol 2, p. 66. F. Tiradritti (ed), Il Cammino di Harwa, Milan 1999, pp.19-21 [5]. (picture wrongly set under [4])
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 24 May, Leeds, Henry Moore Exhibition. 2008, 3 Mar-20 Jul, Cankarjev Dom, Slovenia, Pharaonic Renaissance. 2008, 4 Aug-9 Nov. Budapest, Museum of Fine Arts, Renaissance in Pharaonic Egypt.
Condition: fair - damage to back of head and front of plinth
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
